tweet: As we close out #AAPIHM, I want to honor the diverse and growing AAPI community in our congressional district. These Americans' journey for opportunity and representation continues, and I'm proud to march alongside them.

#ICYMI -- Check out my interview on @CNNSitRoom today regarding the need to continue holding President Trump and his administration accountable. I believe Special Counsel #Mueller, and all Americans, are depending on us to carry out this important constitutional obligation. pic.twitter.com/qIfd6xi9Ns
Tune in to @CNNSitRoom at 5 pm ET where I'll be speaking about Special Counsel #Mueller's statement today and what it means for our ongoing congressional investigations into this administration.

Special Counsel Mueller is stepping down from his post, but this is not the end of the investigation into Russian hacking of our election. Congress must continue this vital inquiry in order to protect our democracy and bring to justice all involved in this attack on our nation.
A big congrats to Owen Norwalk and Aryan Sant for making it to this year's @ScrippsBee! These young H-O-O-S-I-E-R-S make @IPSSchools and our community proud. https://bit.ly/2I1CnDj
Today, on #MemorialDay, and every day, we honor the servicemembers who paid the ultimate sacrifice in defense of our nation. Their bravery must not be forgotten. pic.twitter.com/TQXpdAKT8f

The big day is here! Looking forward to the #Indy500 today, when the eyes of the world will be on our city and the thrilling competition at @IMS. Wishing all the drivers a fun, fast and safe race! @IndyCar

I'm honored to join my friends at the @AmericanLegion in observing #PoppyDay. This flower, which flourished in battlefields following WWI, helps us remember and honor the fallen who fought to defend our nation, as well as the servicemembers and veterans still among us. Thank you! pic.twitter.com/hmzawE83XU

In this week's @IndyRecorder, I'm writing about the importance of the #EqualityAct, which passed the House of Representatives last Friday. This bill is a major step in our effort to ensure everyone's basic human rights.   https://bit.ly/2JCe4PI

Pleased to be taking part in this incredibly important hearing at @HouseIntel. The wide variety of threats to our national security demand a diverse intelligence community that can better protect us! https://twitter.com/HouseIntel/status/1131554200624742401 …

President Trump could have met with congressional Dems today and made progress on much-needed improvements to our nation's aging #infrastructure. But instead he stormed out of what should have been a constructive meeting.

Public servants must be guided by ethics, not ego.

On this day 100 years ago, the House of Representatives passed the #19thAmendment, which gave women the right to vote. This was a major breakthrough in our journey for equality and representation. Today, and every day, we honor all the women who fight for a seat at the table. pic.twitter.com/Z2FN8ixega

One way we can do this is by passing legislation that affirms our rights. That's why I co-authored the #NOBANAct, which would end the shameful #MuslimBan. I'm honored to stand with @MuslimAdvocates, whose tireless efforts made this critical bill and this amazing event possible.

I'm in Washington today, but my heart is with Hoosiers rallying at the Indiana statehouse to protect women's constitutionally protected #reprorights from extreme anti-choice laws being passed. I stand with you and will work hard in Congress to #StopTheBans.

But last night, as a diverse group gathered together, it was also an occasion to recommit ourselves to the shared goal of standing up for Muslims -- and all people -- who face discrimination. We can and we will overcome the forces of oppression.

It was an honor to host an iftar in the U.S. Capitol last night, along with my congressional colleagues @RepRashida and @Ilhan. This sacred tradition of breaking the daily fast during #Ramadan is a time for unity and fellowship. pic.twitter.com/I1cCoUWX5Q

That's why I have reintroduced the Duck Boat Safety Act (H.R. 2799), legislation that takes much-needed action by implementing these safety recommendations. This will make duck boats safer and more buoyant, and protect people on board. Let's get this common-sense bill passed! pic.twitter.com/UB0JGEWvId

For years, duck boat safety recommendations from @NTSB have been ignored. The effects have been deadly -- like last year, when a duck boat sank in Missouri, killing 17 passengers, some of whom were my constituents. It's clear we need to act on these warnings to save lives.

Historic indeed! I am proud to vote for the #EqualityAct today, which extends strong federal protections from discrimination to #LGBTQ Americans. Today's historic passage marks a big step in the effort to make this bill law, and the fight to achieve liberty and justice for all. pic.twitter.com/k4Tg3TwK9P

This bill is a great start to fixing the major issues that exist in our health care system, but more work remains. Let's build on this success to achieve more reforms that ensure the right to quality and affordable health coverage for every American.

H.R. 987 also contains a provision I cosponsored that makes it illegal for prescription drug manufacturers to use a practice called “pay-for-delay” -- an unfair tactic that prevents generic manufacturers from bringing cheaper drugs to market.

This comprehensive bill accomplishes a great deal, including banning "junk" health care plans that harm people with pre-existing conditions, and providing states with more resources to increase health coverage.

Today, we made good on that promise by passing H.R. 987, the Strengthening Health Care and Lowering Prescription Drug Costs Act, which helps protect the #ACA from the sabotage of the Trump Administration.
Last November, Americans gave @HouseDemocrats a majority in large part due to the urgent need to shore up our health care system and bring down the cost of prescription drugs.

Extreme anti-choice laws passed in Alabama, Georgia and other states threaten #ReproRights as never before. Make no mistake -- these extremists are taking away a woman's right to make her own health care decisions, and the effects will be tragic and deadly. We must fight back. pic.twitter.com/Aim7GItlub

It's #InfrastructureWeek! As a member of @TransportDems, I'm continuing my work to renew and expand our nation's infrastructure network, which will create jobs, clean up our environment, and keep us safer. This is a bipartisan priority that will benefit all Americans.
Very concerned about China’s encroachment of our US rail stock. https://twitter.com/TransportDems/status/1129040660034707456 …

Do you hear that stretching sound? It's the sound of @HouseGOP bending logic to justify opposing the #EqualityAct. Here's the truth: this bill gives #LGBTQ people the same civil rights protections afforded to millions of other Americans. It's the fair and right thing to do.

Some claim the 737 Max 8 was simply an updated version of a safe workhorse. But in today's @TransportDems hearing, we're learning that it has gone through major design changes. There must be more direct safety certification, inspection and training before these planes fly again. pic.twitter.com/wRDFiVYq6Z

As Senator Richard Lugar is laid to rest today, I'm reflecting upon the legacy that he and fellow Hoosier, Senator Birch Bayh, have left behind. It's up to us to protect the spirit of statesmanship they exemplified, or risk losing the country they loved. https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/politics/443618-bayh-lugar-and-the-hoosier-spirit-of-statesmanship?rnd=1557853409 …

It’s unacceptable that President Trump is threatening to veto @HouseDemocrats’ bill to strengthen health care and lower prescription drug costs. Time after time, he continues to use his power to enrich big business and block reforms that help working families catch a break.

Happy #MothersDay! Today, and every day, we honor the sacrifices mothers make, give thanks for the unconditional love they provide, and pledge to support policies that uplift and strengthen women and families. pic.twitter.com/A9AimeIw4M

Today I spoke on the House floor about the need to block the #Trump administration's efforts to sabotage the #ACA and harm millions of Americans living with pre-existing conditions. H.R. 986 is a major step in protecting these Americans, and I fully support this bill. pic.twitter.com/uzTTNFBz61

Indiana's economic engine runs on the strength of small businesses. This #SmallBusinessWeek, we honor Hoosier entrepreneurs and others across America. And I pledge to continue supporting policies that prioritize main street over Wall Street. pic.twitter.com/JQPr5B747j

I've got the gavel this afternoon! Starting now, I'll be filling in for @SpeakerPelosi by presiding over the House floor as 'Speaker Pro Tempore.' Watch live on @cspan -->  https://www.c-span.org/  pic.twitter.com/xM5r6ECSqB

No matter the issue, the administration's game plan is the same -- to willfully ignore efforts to hold it accountable to the American people. The President and his cabinet aren’t above the law, and Congress won't rest until we get the truth. They can't stonewall forever.

Members of President Trump's inner circle are also refusing to fully comply with congressional inquiries into attacks on Americans' health care, the heartless #FamilySeparation policy, attempts to prevent a full count in the upcoming Census, and more.

Remember the word "stonewalling."

It has become this administration's favorite tactic, and it's not only being used to prevent Americans from knowing the real findings and implications of the #MuellerReport.

Teachers nurture, educate and shape the next generation of leaders, and we must continue working to make sure they have the resources they need and the respect they deserve. To celebrate #TeacherAppreciationWeek give a shout out to your favorite teacher by replying below! pic.twitter.com/fCYvPp98D2

It has been one year since the Trump administration began its cruel and reckless #FamilySeparation policy. Today, families remain divided as a result of this effort, but President Trump actually regrets ending it! This is unacceptable. We won't rest #UntilEveryFamilyIsReunited. pic.twitter.com/vvkEK1TkPV

This is wonderful news for people living with #HIV and wouldn't be possible without years of tireless advocacy and research. But there's more work to be done. We must continue to fight stigma and protect programs that help these individuals thrive. https://cnn.it/2VdZunE

As we embark on the holy month of #Ramadan, my wish is that this period of fasting and sacrifice brings all Muslims closer to our faith, each other, and the values of Islam. #RamadanKareem! pic.twitter.com/dFFHR8ETAq

Ripping health care from millions of people is nothing to celebrate, but that’s just what Republicans did after they passed #Trumpcare two years ago today. Thank goodness Americans’ tireless activism kept this awful bill from becoming law. Let’s keep striving to #ProtectOurCare. pic.twitter.com/tRZI7unOs1

I really enjoyed this roundtable with my fellow @TransportDems and infrastructure stakeholders! Today, people of many backgrounds and political persuasions came together to celebrate the life of Senator Birch Bayh, a man who never stopped fighting for the rights and well-being of his fellow Hoosiers. America has a moral obligation to lead on the global effort to stop #ClimateChange, which is harming our environment, our economy and public health in Indiana, across America and around the world -- particularly in low-income communities bearing the brunt of its negative effects.
